case_vignette: A 35-year-old man presents with pain in his feet during exercise and at rest. He says that his fingers and toes become pale upon exposure to cold temperatures. He has an extensive smoking history, but no history of diabetes mellitus nor hyperlipidemia. He used to exercise frequently but has stopped because of the symptoms. On inspection, a tiny ulcer is found on his toe. On laboratory analysis, his blood sugar, blood pressure, and lipids are all within the normal range.
question: Which is the most probable diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Cardiovascular System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got pain in my feet when I'm moving around and also when I'm just sitting or lying down, and my fingers and toes turn really pale when they get cold.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
It's been happening for a while now; that's why I had to stop my regular workouts.
Do you notice these symptoms improving with rest or warmth?
Yes, my fingers and toes only go pale when they're cold.
Have you noticed any sores or ulcers on your fingers or toes that don't heal well?
Yes, there's a tiny sore on one of my toes.
Do you have any known allergies, rheumatic diseases, or autoimmune conditions?
No, I don't have any of those conditions.
Do you smoke or use tobacco products?
Yes, I have a long history of smoking.
Is there a family history of cardiovascular diseases such as heart attacks or strokes?
I haven't mentioned anything about my family's medical history.
Have you experienced symptoms such as chest pain, shortness of breath, or heart palpitations?
No, I haven't experienced those symptoms.
What is your age and sex?
I'm a 35-year-old man.
Are you currently taking any medications?
I haven't mentioned taking any medications.
Final Diagnosis: Raynaud's phenomenon secondary to smoking.

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A 35-year-old man visits his healthcare provider complaining of pain in his feet during movement and when at rest, as well as the discoloration of his fingers and toes when exposed to cold. He mentions that these symptoms have been ongoing for a while and have forced him to stop his regular workouts. The patient also notes that he has a long history of smoking and has a tiny sore on one of his toes. He denies any other medical conditions or medications and has not mentioned his family's medical history.
trial_0.multiturn_frq: **Final Diagnosis:** Raynaud's phenomenon likely complicated by critical limb ischemia.
trial_0.singleturn_frq: **Final Diagnosis:** Raynaud's disease possibly with a component of peripheral arterial disease (PAD).
